title: Employee Represented by Nichols Kaster, PLLP Files Overtime Lawsuit Against Killion Communications Consultants, Inc.
text: Email This Story Printer Friendly PDF Version RSS Feed Employee Represented by Nichols Kaster, PLLP Files Overtime Lawsuit Against Killion Communications Consultants, Inc. The complaint alleges Killion failed to pay legally required overtime premium of one and one-half times his hourly rate for the overtime hours he worked over 40 per week, in violation of the Fair Labor Standards Act. Killion Communications failed to abide by one of the most basic and fundamental requirements of the FLSA--pay your employees time and a half for their overtime MINNEAPOLIS, MN, October 08,   On September 23, 2015, an employee of Killion Communications Consultants, Inc. ("Killion") filed a Complaint against the company in the Central District of Illinois seeking overtime pay. The named plaintiff, an outside plant engineer, brought the case on behalf of himself and all similarly situated employees nationwide who were paid "straight time" for all hours worked. Plaintiff's complaint alleges that Killion paid the named plaintiff an hourly rate, but failed to pay him the legally required overtime premium of one and one-half times his hourly rate for the overtime hours he worked over 40 per week, in violation of the Fair Labor Standards Act. The lawsuit seeks overtime premiums plus double damages. Killion Communications Consultants, Inc. is a staffing company that contracts with telecommunications companies such as CenturyLink, AT&T, and Windstream to provide services that include the construction and maintenance of communications systems including voice, data, and fiber optics, within the telecommunications industry. It contracts to provide its services throughout Illinois, Michigan, Minnesota, Wisconsin, Iowa, Kansas, Colorado, and Wyoming. Plaintiff's attorney Jason Hungerford stated, "Killion Communications failed to abide by one of the most basic and fundamental requirements of the FLSA--pay your employees time and a half for their overtime. Our lawsuit seeks to hold Killion to that requirement." Plaintiffs are represented by Matthew H. Morgan and Jason P. Hungerford from Nichols Kaster, PLLP in Minneapolis, Minnesota. The case was filed in the Central District of Illinois, Court File No. 3:15-cv-03277. Additional information about how to make a claim in the case may be found at www.nka.com or by calling Nichols Kaster, PLLP toll free at (877) 448-0492.Nichols Kaster is a nationally recognized plaintiffs firm that focuses on representing employees and consumers whose rights have been violated. The firm was selected as a member of the National Law Journal's Litigation Boutiques Hot List, ranked as a Best Law Firm by U.S. News & World Report, selected as a top plaintiffs' employment law firm by Law360 and named one the top 50 Elite Trial Lawyers by The National Law Journal and Law.com. The firm is led by its partners, who are regularly selected by their peers as Super Lawyers, and sit on the boards of numerous professional organizations, including the National Association of Employment Lawyers, the ABA Fair Labor Standards Legislation Committee and the Council for the Minnesota State Bar Association's Consumer Litigation Section. # # #
